content.question: Which of the following gives the length of the curve defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, e to the t power, times sine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, e to the t power, times cosine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 3, of, the square root of open parenthesis, e to the t power, times sine t, close parenthesis, squared, plus, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times cosine t, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 0 to 3, of, the square root of open parenthesis, e to the t power, times sine t, plus, e to the t power, times cosine t, close parenthesis, squared, plus, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times cosine t, minus, e to the t power, times sine t, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times sine t, close parenthesis, squared, plus, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times cosine t, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times sine t, plus, e to the t power, times cosine t, close parenthesis, squared, plus, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times cosine t, minus, e to the t power, times sine t, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 3, of, the square root of open parenthesis, e to the t power, times sine t, plus, e to the t power, times cosine t, close parenthesis, squared, plus, open parenthesis, e to the t power, times cosine t, minus, e to the t power, times sine t, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.3: (BC ONLY) Finding Arc Lengths of Curves Given by Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
